name: Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Disaster
source: Investigation Committee, NRC Lessons Learned, Wikipedia Timeline of the Fukushima nuclear accident

timeline.event: M9.0 earthquake; reactors 1–3 scram; grid lost; diesel generators start
Reactor 1 emergency cooling (IC) turns on automatically
Reactor 1 emergency cooling manually shut down (temp dropped; procedure)
First tsunami wave 4 m at gauge
Reactor 1 isolation condenser fails
Major tsunami ~14–15 m; station blackout; diesel generators flooded
Units 1–4 lose AC and DC power; cooling pumps fail
Reactor 1 water level reaches top of fuel; core temp rising
Operators try to start Reactor 1 emergency cooling; it does not function
Government declares nuclear emergency; no leak reported
Reactor 1 fuel fully exposed; fuel damage begins
Evacuation order 3 km; pressure Unit 1 >2× normal
PM and regulators informed of venting plans; approval given
Venting Unit 1 prioritised over Unit 2 (RCIC working on 2)
Decision to vent Unit 1 containment to release pressure
Fresh water injection into Reactor 1 started
Reactor 1 core fully melted (unknown at time)
TEPCO confirms small vapor release from Unit 1
Operators open Unit 1 containment venting line
Steam release to atmosphere confirmed
Hydrogen explosion Unit 1 reactor building; 5 workers injured
Seawater injection into Reactor 1 started
Evacuation zone extended to 20 km

coordination_steps_traditional: TEPCO / government / regulator coordination for venting decision
Limited and poor communications between central and local governments
Evacuation of vulnerable populations delayed and chaotic
quotes: Crisis-command disarray caused by government and TEPCO.
Coordination among the central and local governments was hampered by limited and poor communications. Protective actions were improvised and uncoordinated.
munin_counterfactual: Pre-simulated nuclear cascade scenarios; pre-validated venting and evacuation playbooks; single coordination layer for TEPCO + national + prefectural government.

demo_nodes.label: Venting authorized (0/1)
demo_nodes.note: Delayed ~7+ hours from need to approval/execution
